questions.question: You need to create a resource hierarchy for a company with multiple departments. What is the correct order from top to bottom?
questions.category: Setting up a cloud solution environment
questions.explanation: In Google Cloud, the resource hierarchy goes from Organization (top) to Folders to Projects (bottom).

questions.question: Which IAM role should you assign to a developer who needs to deploy applications but should not be able to delete projects?
questions.category: Setting up a cloud solution environment
questions.explanation: The Editor role allows users to modify most resources but not delete projects.

questions.question: You want to automatically add users to groups when they join your organization. Which Google Cloud service should you use?
questions.category: Setting up a cloud solution environment
questions.explanation: Cloud Identity is used for identity management and can automate user provisioning.

questions.question: Which command enables the Compute Engine API for your current project?
questions.category: Setting up a cloud solution environment
questions.explanation: The correct command is 'gcloud services enable compute.googleapis.com'.

questions.question: You need to increase your project's quota for Compute Engine instances. What should you do?
options: Use the Quotas page in Cloud Console
questions.category: Setting up a cloud solution environment
questions.explanation: You can request quota increases through the Quotas page in the Cloud Console.

questions.question: Which tool helps you analyze your Google Cloud resources and get recommendations?
questions.category: Setting up a cloud solution environment
questions.explanation: Both Cloud Asset Inventory and Gemini Cloud Assist provide resource analysis and recommendations.

questions.question: You want to create a billing alert when your project costs exceed $100. Where should you configure this?
questions.category: Setting up a cloud solution environment
questions.explanation: Billing alerts are configured in the Cloud Billing section of the console.

questions.question: What is the purpose of billing exports in Google Cloud?
options: To export billing data to BigQuery for analysis
To share billing with other projects
questions.category: Setting up a cloud solution environment
questions.explanation: Billing exports allow you to export detailed billing data to BigQuery for analysis.

questions.question: You need to deploy a stateless web application that can scale to zero when not in use. Which compute option is most suitable?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Cloud Run is designed for stateless containers and can scale to zero when not in use.

questions.question: Which storage option provides the highest IOPS for a Compute Engine instance?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Local SSD provides the highest IOPS but is ephemeral and attached to a specific VM instance.

questions.question: You want to create a managed instance group that scales between 3 and 10 instances. Which component do you need first?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: An instance template is required first to define the VM configuration for the managed instance group.

questions.question: What is the main benefit of using Spot VM instances?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Spot VMs offer significantly lower prices compared to standard VMs but can be preempted.

questions.question: You need to deploy a GKE cluster that automatically manages nodes. Which mode should you choose?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: GKE Autopilot automatically manages the underlying infrastructure, including nodes.

questions.question: Which Google Cloud service is best for storing time-series data at scale?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Cloud Bigtable is optimized for time-series data and can handle high throughput.

questions.question: You need to process streaming data in real-time. Which service should you use?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Cloud Dataflow is designed for real-time stream processing and batch processing.

questions.question: Which Cloud Storage class is most cost-effective for data accessed once a month?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Nearline storage is designed for data accessed less than once a month.

questions.question: You want to create a private GKE cluster. What does this mean?
options: Cluster is not accessible from internet
Nodes don't have external IP addresses
Pods can't communicate with each other
Cluster is only accessible by the owner
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: In a private GKE cluster, nodes do not have external IP addresses, enhancing security.

questions.question: Which VPC mode allows you to define custom IP ranges for subnets?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Custom mode VPC networks allow you to define your own subnet IP ranges.

questions.question: You need to allow HTTP traffic to your Compute Engine instances. Which type of firewall rule should you create?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Ingress rules control incoming traffic to your instances.

questions.question: Which load balancer type is best for global HTTP(S) traffic?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: The HTTP(S) Load Balancer is designed for global HTTP(S) traffic with features like SSL termination.

questions.question: What is the main benefit of using Infrastructure as Code (IaC)?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: IaC allows you to version control your infrastructure and create repeatable deployments.

questions.question: Which tool is Google's recommended IaC solution for Google Cloud?
questions.category: Planning and implementing a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Google recommends Fabric FAST as their IaC solution for Google Cloud.

questions.question: How do you SSH into a Compute Engine instance from the command line?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: The correct command is 'gcloud compute ssh instance-name'.

questions.question: You want to create a snapshot of a Compute Engine disk. Which command should you use?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: The correct command is 'gcloud compute snapshots create'.

questions.question: How do you configure a GKE cluster to access Artifact Registry?
options: Configure service account with Artifact Registry Reader role
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Configure the GKE service account with the Artifact Registry Reader role for access.

questions.question: You want to see all pods in a GKE cluster. Which command should you use?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: The correct command is 'kubectl get pods --all-namespaces'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) in GKE?
options: Scale pods horizontally based on metrics
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: HPA automatically scales the number of pods based on observed metrics like CPU utilization.

questions.question: You want to deploy a new version of a Cloud Run service with zero downtime. What should you do?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Traffic splitting allows you to gradually shift traffic to the new version.

questions.question: Which lifecycle rule action permanently deletes objects from Cloud Storage?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: The Delete action permanently removes objects from Cloud Storage.

questions.question: You want to execute a SQL query in BigQuery. Which command should you use?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: The correct command is 'bq query "SELECT * FROM table"'.

questions.question: How do you backup a Cloud SQL instance?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Cloud SQL instances can be backed up using snapshots, exports to Cloud Storage, or automatic backups.

questions.question: You want to add a new subnet to an existing VPC. What must be true about the IP range?
options: It must be in the same region as other subnets
It must not overlap with existing subnets
It must be a public IP range
It must be larger than existing subnets
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Subnet IP ranges must not overlap with other subnets in the same VPC.

questions.question: Which service provides managed DNS for Google Cloud?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Cloud DNS is Google's managed DNS service.

questions.question: You want to create a monitoring alert when CPU utilization exceeds 80%. Which service should you use?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Cloud Monitoring is used to create alerts based on metrics like CPU utilization.

questions.question: Where should you look to troubleshoot application latency issues?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Cloud Trace helps identify and troubleshoot latency issues in applications.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Ops Agent?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: The Ops Agent collects logs and metrics (telemetry data) from VMs.

questions.question: You want to export logs to BigQuery for analysis. Which service should you configure?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Cloud Logging allows you to export logs to destinations like BigQuery.

questions.question: Which log type tracks who did what in your Google Cloud environment?
questions.category: Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
questions.explanation: Audit logs record administrative activities, data access, and system events.

questions.question: What is the difference between basic and predefined IAM roles?
options: Basic roles are broader, predefined roles are more granular
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Basic roles (Owner, Editor, Viewer) are broad, while predefined roles target specific services and actions.

questions.question: You want to create a custom IAM role. Which permissions should you include?
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Following the principle of least privilege, include only the minimum permissions needed.

questions.question: What is the best practice for service account management?
options: Use the same service account for all resources
Create separate service accounts for different functions
Use user accounts instead of service accounts
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Create separate service accounts for different functions to limit the blast radius of potential security issues.

questions.question: How do you assign a service account to a Compute Engine instance?
options: During instance creation or after creation
Service accounts cannot be assigned to instances
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Service accounts can be assigned during instance creation or changed afterward.

questions.question: What is service account impersonation?
options: One service account acting as another
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Service account impersonation allows one principal to act as a service account without using its key.

questions.question: How long do short-lived service account credentials last by default?
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Short-lived service account credentials typically last for 1 hour by default.

questions.question: You want to allow a GKE pod to access Cloud Storage. What should you configure?
options: Service account with appropriate IAM roles
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Configure a service account with appropriate IAM roles and assign it to the GKE pod.

questions.question: Which command shows the current IAM policy for a project?
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: The correct command is 'gcloud projects get-iam-policy PROJECT_ID'.

questions.question: What is the principle of least privilege?
options: Give users minimum access needed to do their job
Give users maximum access for convenience
Give all users the same access level
Give users access only to their own resources
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: The principle of least privilege means giving users only the minimum access needed to perform their job.

questions.question: You need to rotate service account keys regularly. What is the recommended approach?
options: Use short-lived credentials or workload identity
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Using short-lived credentials or workload identity is preferred over manual key rotation.

questions.question: How do you enable audit logging for a specific service?
options: Configure audit logs in Cloud Logging
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Audit logging is configured in Cloud Logging for specific services.

questions.question: What is Workload Identity in GKE?
options: A method to securely access Google Cloud services from GKE
questions.category: Configuring access and security
questions.explanation: Workload Identity allows GKE workloads to securely access Google Cloud services without service account keys.

categories: Setting up a cloud solution environment
Planning and implementing a cloud solution
Ensuring successful operation of a cloud solution
